content: Introduction:
Begin by emphasizing that money is used to buy things we need and want.
Needs vs. Wants:
Needs are things we must have to live, like food, clothes, and a place to live.
Wants are things we would like to have, but we don’t necessarily need them to survive, like toys or video games.(insert some cartoon photos)
Saving Money:
Sometimes, we have to save money to buy something we want.
We can save money by putting some aside from the money we get, like from allowances or gifts. (Insert cartoon image of piggy bank)
Spending Money:
When we spend money, we exchange it for something we want or need.
It’s important to think about whether we really need something before spending money on it. (Cartoon image of someone thinking)
Earning Money:
• People earn money by doing work or providing a service.
For kids, earning money might mean doing chores at home or helping neighbors with tasks. (Insert cartoon image of this example)
Sharing and Giving:
Sometimes, it’s nice to share or give money to help others who need it.
We can donate money to charities or help our friends and family if they need something.(cartoon image)
Budgeting:
Budgeting means deciding how to use our money wisely.
We can make a plan for how much money to save, spend, and share.
Learning About Coins and Bills:
Teach kids about different coins and bills and their values.
Practice counting money to understand its worth.
